conclusion: Analyze forces on bodies A, B, and C using static equilibrium principles.
Body A has weight W_A = mg downward, normal force F upward, frictional force f horizontally, and normal force N_AC from body C.
Body B has weight W_B = 2mg downward, normal force F_B upward, frictional force f_B horizontally, and normal force N_BC from body C.
Body C has weight W_C = mg downward, normal forces N_CA and N_CB from bodies A and B.
For body C, N_CA + N_CB = mg and N_CA = N_CB, thus N_CA = N_CB = mg/2.
For body A, F = mg + N_CA, thus F = 3mg/2.
For body A, f = N_CA, thus f = mg/2.
For body B, F_B = 2mg + N_CB, thus F_B = 5mg/2.
For body B, f_B = N_CB, thus f_B = mg/2.
Maximum static friction f_max = mu F, thus f_max = sqrt(3)mg/4.
Since f = mg/2 and mg/2 < sqrt(3)mg/4, frictional force is within static friction limit.
Final answer: Normal force F on A is 3mg/2, frictional force f is mg/2.
